text: Swire Meeting Minutes​ User Guide WHAT THE APPLICATION DOES Swire Meeting Minutes turns meeting audio into searchable transcripts and polished summaries. It can: • Transcribe speech​ • Tell speakers apart​ • Support many languages in one meeting​ • Produce professional style meeting minutes MAIN FEATURES 1.​UPLOAD AUDIO FILES​ Use this to upload recorded meeting audio for transcription. Supported formats: MP3, WAV, M4A, FLAC, OGG, WEBM​ Maximum file size: 100 MB per audio file How to use:​ • Click the upload area or drag and drop an audio file​ • You can also record audio directly using the Record Audio button​ • Click Clear to remove the selected file 2.​RECORD AUDIO​ Use this to record meetings directly in your browser. How to use:​ • Click Record to start​ • Click Stop to finish​ • Click Clear to delete the recording​ • The timer shows how long you have been recording 3.​UPLOAD MEETING MATERIALS​

Use this to provide agendas, decks and other documents so that summaries are more accurate and contextual. Supported formats: PDF, Word (DOC/DOCX), PowerPoint (PPT/PPTX), Excel (XLS/XLSX)​ Maximum file size: 20 MB per document How to use:​ • Click the upload area or drag and drop documents​ • Click Add More to upload additional documents​ • Click Clear All to remove all documents​ • Click the X next to a document to remove it individually 4.​SELECT OUTPUT LANGUAGE​ Choose the language you want for the final summary. Options:​ • English​ • Cantonese (summary in Traditional Chinese, Cantonese context)​ • Chinese (summary in Simplified Chinese) How to use:​ • Click your preferred language button​ • The selected language is highlighted 5.​SELECT ANALYSIS TYPE​ Choose the meeting type so the AI can format and prioritise content appropriately.

How to use:​ • Click your preferred language button​ • The selected language is highlighted 5.​SELECT ANALYSIS TYPE​ Choose the meeting type so the AI can format and prioritise content appropriately. Options:​ • Board Meeting​ • Division Review Meeting​ (Property, Aviation, Beverages and Food Chain, Marine Services, Trading and Industrial, Healthcare)​ • Executive Committee Meeting​ • Sustainability Committee Meeting​ • Audit and Risk Committee Meeting​ • Special Board Meeting How to use:​ • Click one analysis type card​ • The selected card is highlighted

6.​MULTI LANGUAGE DETECTION​ Turn this on if your meeting uses more than one language. Use this when:​ • People switch between languages in the same meeting​ • Both English and Chinese (or other languages) are spoken Leave it off for single language meetings for faster processing. How to use:​ • Toggle the Multi language detection switch on or off 7.​GENERATE MEETING MINUTES​ This starts transcription and summarisation. How to use:​ • Upload an audio file​ • Select output language​ • Select analysis type​ • Click Generate Meeting Minutes You will see status messages such as:​ • Uploading...​ • Processing audio...​ • Analyzing transcript... Approximate processing times:​ • 5 minutes of audio: about 1 to 2 minutes​ • 15 minutes of audio: about 2 to 4 minutes​ • 30 minutes of audio: about 5 to 8 minutes​ • 1 hour of audio: about 10 to 15 minutes 8.​VIEW TRANSCRIPT​ After processing, you can review the full transcript.

inutes of audio: about 2 to 4 minutes​ • 30 minutes of audio: about 5 to 8 minutes​ • 1 hour of audio: about 10 to 15 minutes 8.​VIEW TRANSCRIPT​ After processing, you can review the full transcript. You will see:​ • Speaker labels (Speaker 1, Speaker 2, etc.)​ • Timestamps for each segment​ • Transcribed text​ • Language tags if multi language mode is on

How to use:​ • The transcript appears automatically when processing completes​ • Scroll to review the content​ • Click a segment to edit the text or change the speaker name 9.​EDIT TRANSCRIPT​ Use this to correct errors or tidy up speaker names. How to use:​ • Switch to Edit mode​ • Click a speaker name to rename it​ • Click a text segment to change the words​ • Changes are saved automatically 10.​ VIEW AI SUMMARY​ This shows a structured summary of the meeting. You will see:​ • Meeting overview and main topics​ • Key points discussed​ • Decisions made​ • Action items (if any)​ • Next steps (if any) How to use:​ • The summary appears after processing completes​ • Read through to check accuracy​ • Click Edit if you want to adjust anything 11.​ EDIT SUMMARY​ Use this to refine the AI generated summary.

How to use:​ • Click Edit in the summary section​ • Change, remove or add text directly​ • Add any missing decisions or action items​ • Changes are saved automatically 12.​ DOWNLOAD RESULTS​

Export your meeting output in different formats. Download options:​ • PDF for a formatted meeting minutes document​ • RTTM for speaker diarisation data​ • JSON for full raw meeting data How to use:​ • Click Download PDF to export as PDF​ • Click Download RTTM for diarisation data​ • Click Download JSON for raw data 13.​ FINALIZE MEETING​ Save the finalised meeting into the database with proper metadata. How to use:​ • Click Finalize Meeting​ • Enter meeting title​ • Enter meeting number​ • Enter your name (person finalising)​ • Click Save 14.​ VIEW SAVED MEETINGS​ Use this to browse, open and manage past meetings.

Click Finalize Meeting​ • Enter meeting title​ • Enter meeting number​ • Enter your name (person finalising)​ • Click Save 14.​ VIEW SAVED MEETINGS​ Use this to browse, open and manage past meetings. You will see:​ • List of saved meetings​ • Meeting title, number and date​ • Meeting type and status​ • Options to view, edit or delete How to use:​ • Click the Saved Meetings tab​ • Browse the list​ • Click a meeting to open its details​ • Click Delete to remove a meeting​ • Click Refresh to reload the list 15.​ CHATBOT KNOWLEDGE ASSISTANT​ Ask questions about meetings or how to use the system.

How to use:​ • Click the Knowledge tab​ • Type your question in the chat box​ • Press Enter or click Send​ • The chatbot will reply with relevant information​ • Continue the conversation with follow up questions You can ask about:​ • Content of a specific meeting​ • General questions about meetings​ • Differences between meeting types​ • How to use features in the application PROCESSING STATUS MESSAGES Uploading...​ Your audio file is being sent to the server. Processing audio...​ The system is transcribing and analysing the audio. Analyzing transcript...​ The AI is reviewing the transcript and creating the summary. Done​ Processing is complete. Transcript and summary are ready. Error​ Something went wrong. Check the error message for details. COMMON ISSUES AND SOLUTIONS 1.​UPLOAD FAILED​ Possible causes:​ • File is larger than 100 MB​ • Unsupported file format​ • Network connection issues What to try:​ • Compress the audio file​ • Convert it to a supported format (MP3 recommended)​

• Check your internet connection​ • Try uploading again 2.​PROCESSING FAILED​ Possible causes:​ • Corrupted audio file​ • Audio contains no speech​ • Output language does not match the spoken language What to try:​ • Use a different audio file​ • Confirm there is clear speech in the recording​ • Check that the selected language matches the audio​ • Contact the system administrator if the problem continues 3.​EMPTY TRANSCRIPT​ Possible causes:​ • No speech in the recording​ • Very poor audio quality​ • Wrong language selected​ • Audio volume too low What to try:​ • Verify that there is speech in the audio​ • Use a higher quality recording​ • Try a different language setting​ • Re record in a quieter environment if possible 4.​SUMMARY NOT GENERATED​ Possible causes:​ • Transcript is empty​ • Processing error​ • AI service is currently unavailable What to try:​ • Check whether the transcript was created​ • Run the processing again​ • Contact the system administrator if it still fails

BEST PRACTICES For better transcription quality: 1.​Use good quality recording equipment​ 2.​Minimise background noise​ 3.​Avoid multiple people speaking at the same time​ 4.​Speak clearly and at a steady pace​ 5.​Record in a quiet room where possible​ For better AI summaries: 1.​Upload agendas, slide decks and other materials​ 2.​Choose the correct analysis type for the meeting​ 3.​Set the correct output language​ 4.​Review and lightly edit the summary before sharing​ 5.​Add any missing decisions, owners or deadlines manually​ For faster processing: 1.​Use shorter audio files when practical​ 2.​Turn off multi language detection for single language meetings​ 3.​Compress audio before uploading if files are very large​ 4.​Avoid peak usage periods if processing is slow​ FILE SIZE GUIDELINES Audio files:​ • Maximum: 100 MB​

• Recommended: under 50 MB for speed​ • Format: MP3 recommended for compatibility Document files:​ • Maximum: 20 MB per file​ • Recommended: under 10 MB per file​ • Formats: PDF, Word, PowerPoint, Excel LANGUAGE SUPPORT Supported spoken languages include:​ • English​ • Cantonese​ • Mandarin​ • Traditional Chinese​ • Simplified Chinese​ • Many other languages through automatic detection Output languages:​ • English​ • Traditional Chinese (for Cantonese meetings)​ • Simplified Chinese (for Mandarin meetings) PRIVACY AND DATA Data storage:​ • Audio files are stored on the server​ • Transcripts and summaries are saved in the database​ • All data stays on the local server​ • No data is sent to external services Data security:​ • Only authorised users can access the system​ • Meeting data is stored securely​ • Contact the system administrator if you need data to be deleted GETTING HELP If you need assistance:

1.​Refer to this user guide​ 2.​Read any error messages shown in the application​ 3.​Contact your system administrator​ 4.​Check if the issue is already known or documented internally​ VERSION INFORMATION Application: Swire Meeting Minutes Main capabilities:​ • Speech to text transcription​ • Speaker diarisation​ • Multi language support​ • AI generated summaries​ • Meeting storage and management​ • Chatbot knowledge assistant Limitations:​ • Maximum audio file: 100 MB​ • Maximum document file: 20 MB​ • Processing time depends on audio length and system load Last updated: November 2025
